Dear Ms. Klinski,
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at Claudia Triestram 616-552-3662.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation After the youth assaulted him, staff slammed youth's head against
the wall and put him in a chokehold.
Investigation This complaint was received on 05/02/2023 and investigated
jointly with the MDHHS Specialist.
I interviewed complainant via telephone on 05/02/2023. They
reported Youth A engaged in a physical altercation with another
Youth, afterwards Youth A attempted to assault a staff member.
Youth A reported that staff put him in a chokehold and hit his head
against the wall. Youth A has red marks on the front of his neck,
red marks on left side of his forehead, and an abrasion on the
right side of his head.
I interviewed Director at the facility on 05/03/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialists. Director reported there was a physical
altercation between Youth A and Youth B and while counseling
the two youths, Youth A assaulted Staff 1. Youth A was restrained
and afterwards Youth A reported Staff 1 put him in a chokehold.
Staff 1 has been put on administrative leave pending the
investigation. Staff 1 has been employed at the facility for 24 years
and has no disciplinary actions in his personnel file. Director
reviewed the video footage and the part of the incident where
Youth A is restrained is not visible in video.
I interviewed Youth A at the facility on 05/03/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Youth A is 17 years old and has been at
the facility one year. Youth A reported he got into a physical
altercation with Youth B in the classroom. He and Youth B were
separated and taken back to the pod. While talking with Staff 1
about the fight Youth A got mad at Staff 1 and punched Staff 1 in
the face. Youth A said Staff 1 put him in a chokehold with his face
against the wall, and hit his head against the wall. The nurse
examined him because he had bruises on his neck, face, and
2

head. He said this was the only time he has been restraint and
there are no prior issues or concerns with Staff 1.
I interviewed Youth B at the facility on 05/03/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Youth B is 12 years old and has been at
the facility for 2 months. Youth B reported he and Youth A got into
a fight yesterday, because he kicked Youth A’s chair in the
classroom. He punched Youth A twice and Youth A punched him
twice in the face. He said staff separated them and escorted both
boys back to the pod. Staff 1 came on the pod to talk to them
about the fight. Staff 1 told Youth A he was wrong for hitting Youth
B and Youth A punched Staff 1 in the face. Staff 1 put Youth A in
a chokehold and hit his head against the wall. Youth B said Youth
A’s head was bleeding afterwards.
I interviewed Staff 1 at the facility on 05/03/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 has been employed at the facility
for 21 years and is the facility manager. He reported on
05/02/2023, he was counseling Youth A and B because they
engaged in a physical altercation. He told Youth A that he should
not have hit Youth B, because Youth B is a lot younger than him.
Youth A got mad at him and punched Staff 1 in the face. Staff 1
said he and Staff 2 restrained Youth A in a two-person restraint.
He denied choking or hitting Youth A’s head against the wall. He
said Youth A was not injured during the restraint and he did not
observe any bruises or marks on Youth A after the restraint.
I interviewed Staff 2 at the facility on 05/03/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 is a security officer and has been
working at the facility for 6 months. He reported on 05/02/2023 he
assisted with escorting Youth A and B back to the pod after they
got into a fight. He did not observe any injuries on either boy after
the fight. He said Staff 1 was talking to Youth A about the fight,
and that’s when Youth A punched Staff 1 in the face. He and Staff
1 restrained Youth A in a two-person standing restraint. He denied
Staff 1 choked or hitting Youth A’s head against the wall. He said
Youth A did not have any injuries when they escorted him to his
room after the restraint.
I interviewed Staff 3 at the facility on 05/03/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 3 has been employed at the facility
for 18 years and is a supervisor. Staff 3 was in the control room on
05/02/2023 and only witnessed Youth A being restrained by Staff
1 and 2. He denied witnessing Staff 1 choke or hit Youth A’s head
against the wall.
3

I interviewed Nurse at the facility on 05/03/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. She examined Youth A on 05/02/2023,
Youth A has red marks on the front of his neck, red marks on left
side of his forehead, and an abrasion on the right side of his head.
Youth A reported Staff 1 put him in a chokehold and caused the
injuries. She said Youth A’s injuries could have been caused by a
chokehold as Youth A reported.
I interviewed Staff 4 at the facility on 05/17/2023. Staff 4 has been
employed at the facility for 15 years and is a manager. Staff 4 was
in the control room on 05/02/2023 and came out of the control
room after Youth A was restrained. He denied witnessing Staff 1
choke or hit Youth A’s head against the wall.
Video Footage Reviewed:
Video dated 05/02/2023 at 09:39 am. Youth A observed charging
at Staff 1, who was sitting in a chair next to Youth B, Youth A
strikes Staff 1 in the face and shoulder. Staff 1 stands up, and with
the assistance of Staff 2, they attempt to restrain Youth A. Youth A
is resisting and the restraint moves under the camera and is no
longer visible for the duration of the restraint, as there is a blind
spot from the cameras in this corner. Then Youth A is seen being
escorted to his room by Staff 1 and Staff 2.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 05/02/2023 at 9:39 am. Youth A
became upset while being counseled about his behavior.
Youth A assaulted Staff 1 by striking him in head and neck
while sitting. Staff 1 stood up and Youth A struck Staff 1
again in the arm, and shoulder. Youth A was then
physically managed by Staff 1 with the assistance of Staff
2. Staff utilized the Standing Primary Restraint Technique
for 24 seconds once Youth A was able to regain self-control
he was released and went to his room. Youth A reported
that he sustained bruising to the right side of his neck, and
scratches to the right side of his head during the incident.
• Medical Assessment for Youth A dated 05/02/2023 at 11:45
am completed by Nurse. Youth A had superficial abrasion
right side of scalp, area of open skin and dried blood behind
the right ear, and red marks on his neck and left forehead.
Youth reported Staff 1 put him in a choke hold and
slammed his head against the wall.
4

Analysis The facility is not compliant with the rule as there is sufficient
evidence based on Youth A's and Youth B's interviews, which
were consistent in reporting staff put Youth A in a chokehold and
hit Youth A’s his head against the wall. The three staff members
interviewed denied Youth A was put in a chokehold, but Youth A
was examined by the nurse and was found to have injuries around
his neck and head that are consistent with being choked.
Consultation
It is suggested that the agency install a camera on the opposite
side of the room from where this restraint occurred to eliminate the
blind spot in this corner. It is also suggested that they review all
video angle to assess for additional blind spots that may need
coverage
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff member lacks the ability to perform job duties.
Investigation During a conference call on May 22, 2023, MDHHS worker
reported there was a preponderance of evidence and Staff 1 will
have a confirmed case.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as Staff 1 has a confirmed
case.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SI 2022C0207002 with approved CAP
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
